main event: Two star-like objects were observed in Centerville, Ohio on 21 August 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes,The objects appeared brighter than the background sky,The report suggests that the objects may have been Venus and were very bright at the time,The objects moved rapidly and disappeared after sunset,The observer speculated that the objects might have been a weather balloon or sunlight reflecting.
witness description: The observer was uncertain about the exact nature of the objects but noted their brightness and rapid disappearance.
